reviews.review_text:
A great place to eat, drink and relax on the Utorda beach in South Goa. The beach was less crowded and very good for walking although it was littered with starfish. We went there at sunset time, watched the sunset from the beach and then went to Jamming goat for dinner.
There were free tables available around 6:30PM. The staff is very courteous and attentive. The food was plated beautifully, the taste was good but was a little bland. We had to ask for seasoning and chilli flakes with the pasta, for chutney with the kebabs and sauce with tacos. Still, it was a memorable experience. Do visit this place if you are in South Goa.

The love, passion, dedication and attention to detail that the staff, the chef and the bartender here gives to their work shows how much pride they take in putting together the experience for you. The food here is delectable.

The crab toast is pure bliss. With every bite I kept becoming sad, that ye khatam ho jaayega. I wish I had a limitless tummy and I could just keep eating this. It is seriously that good. The Dahi Papdi Chaat is another kick ass preperation where they have made a foam with curd. It's so light. The mocktails are equally impressive. Everything we ordered was really well prepared. It's a place that you will want to come back to. And I am already waiting for you to go back. Thank you Jamming Goat. You are totally worth it and a must must go to spot when in Goa.

Outstanding food and service! We popped in this evening as weâ€™re staying nearby at the Kenilworth where the food has been rubbish. We are so glad we did! The crusted prawn starter is to die for. The jamming goat speciality curry is also 10/10! Would highly recommend!
